head.title: Julia Faber and John Goldberg Marry

hedline.hl1: Julia Faber and John Goldberg Marry

block.p: Julia Schuster Faber, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter L. Faber of New York, was married yesterday at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden to John Carlo Paul Goldberg, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Homer Goldberg of Setauket, L.I. Judge Jack B. Weinstein of Federal District Court in Brooklyn performed the ceremony.

The bride, 27 years old, is keeping her name. She graduated summa cum laude from Bowdoin College, where she was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and received a master's degree in politics from Princeton University. She is to begin law studies at Harvard University in September. Her father is a partner in the New York law firm of Kaye, Scholer, Fierman, Hays & Handler. Her mother, Joan S. Faber, is a tax consultant at Ernst & Young in New York.

Julia Schuster Faber, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Peter L. Faber of New York, was married yesterday at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden to John Carlo Paul Goldberg, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Homer Goldberg of Setauket, L.I. Judge Jack B. Weinstein of Federal District Court in Brooklyn performed the ceremony.

The bride, 27 years old, is keeping her name. She graduated summa cum laude from Bowdoin College, where she was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and received a master's degree in politics from Princeton University. She is to begin law studies at Harvard University in September. Her father is a partner in the New York law firm of Kaye, Scholer, Fierman, Hays & Handler. Her mother, Joan S. Faber, is a tax consultant at Ernst & Young in New York.

The bridegroom, 29, graduated from Wesleyan University and received a master's degree in politics from Oxford University and a law degree from New York University. He is a doctoral candidate in politics at Princeton. He is to start work as a law clerk for Judge Weinstein next month. His mother, Elizabeth Goldberg, is the director of Gallery North in Setauket. His father is a Distinguished Teaching Professor of English at the State University of New York at Stony Brook, L.I.
